alert.note: Alert for Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued March 28 at 3:08AM PDT until March 28 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall remains possible today with scattered heavy showers and isolated thunderstorms. * WHERE...Near and within the Dolan Fire and Colorado Fire burn scars along the Big Sur coastline. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and isolated thunderstorms could impact the Colorado and Dolan wildfire burn scars today. Heavy downpours may lead to flash flooding and debris flows in these areas - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
